snippet: The mother and older brother of Chen Guangcheng, a prominent rights advocate who fled to the United States last year, can now apply for visas to see him.
abstract: Wang Jinxiang and Chen Guangfu, mother and brother of Chen Guangcheng, prominent Chinese rights advocate who fled to United States in 2012, are granted Chinese passports, allowing them to start applying for visas to see him; granting of passports appears to be a concession made by Chinese government in prelude to summit meeting between Pres Xi Jinping and Pres Obama.
lead_paragraph: The mother and older brother of Chen Guangcheng, a prominent rights advocate who fled to the United States last year, can now apply for visas to see him.

headline.seo: Family of Chinese Rights Advocate Given Passports
headline.main: 2 Relatives of Dissident Get Passports From China
headline.print_headline: 2 Relatives Of Dissident Get Passports From China

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
